job_title: Coordinator in East Boston, MA
pros: Leadership truly cares about providing quality healthcare, organizational culture is great, employee engagement, job security, promotes promoting from within and the professional development of staff, the company works hard to provide annual increases and bonuses to staff, great benefits!
cons: It is a nonprofit so compensation is not the same as some of the other bigger companies in the area but that is to be expected-comp is competitive though

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Winthrop, MA
pros: Absolutely great employer and benefits.
cons: Have to wait 1 year to change jobs

job_title: Transportation Associate in East Boston, MA
pros: Great if you love driving. Great Benifits along with separate sick and vacation time. Plenty of over time.
cons: Front office needs someone with sincere people, compassion skills but not all! Management could be better, more open with listening to the drivers concerns and or issues especially if told repeatedly! action needs to be taken to resolve the problem or issue and not be blown off. Drivers over worked at times Very physical hands on job demanding at times.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in East Boston, MA

job_title: Marketing Manager in Boston, MA
pros: Love the patients and communities we serve. The benefits at health centers are great, something to keep in mind when searching.
cons: The pay tends to be lower than industry and private sectors, rather than non-profit. However the benefits need to be taken into consideration as a full package.

review_title: EBNHC is a good place to work

pros: good benefits, people are good working as a team, managers understand and are very respectful, there are space to grow
cons: beside the pay rate I don't have anything bad to say I just believe they have to work better to pay more they always pay the minimum for a work that in other places pay more

review_title: Good work experience, but more money is deserved
job_title: Lead Navigator in East Boston, MA
pros: Great environment and caring for the elders

job_title: Physician Assistant in North Miami Beach, FL
pros: Learn good skills, rewarding, work with MD's and specialists.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in East Boston, MA
pros: Have their own parking lot.

job_title: Medical Biller in Boston, MA
pros: great time off, great co-workers.
cons: Low pay. Need better organization. Some departments wanted to remain the same, and didn't want to change/improve.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Boston, MA
pros: Diverse workplace, good benefits, we do a lot for the community and they are grateful.
cons: Pay, burn out, don’t value workers, everything is all about business

review_title: Good work place for healthcare industry

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Boston, MA

job_title: Medical Assistant in East Boston, MA
pros: Benefits are amazing. Flexible schedule

job_title: Public Health Fellow in Boston, MA
pros: Fulfilling work, community engagement, great direct service care

job_title: Physician in Boston, MA
pros:
Diverse community
Excellent management
Very light call
Flexible scheduling
cons: Lack of productivity based bonuses

job_title: Provider in East Boston, MA
pros: The providers and front line staff are incredibly dedicated and passionate. The patients are grateful for everything we do. Many of my co-workers are people that have become my friends.
cons: The top leaders of the organization pat themselves on the back at every opportunity for a job well done, and ignore the reality of the employee culture and job satisfaction. Communication and transparency is non-existent. Proactive measures to help the community are lacking. The top leaders along with the administrative departments are quick to admonish and terminate anyone who criticizes their decisions or actions, therefore discouraging open dialogue. The health center seems more focused on the financial side of the operation, ironic given the health center is a non-profit entity. In many ways, the health center is stuck in the dark ages of leadership in that it is authoritarian and elitist. With the exception of the CEO, it is a white male dominated leadership team with no room for diversity and change. This is not a place where you can hope to be promoted or heard.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in East Boston, MA
pros: Benefits are amazing and the co workers are great.
cons: I haven’t run into a con yet.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Boston, MA
pros: Benefits are good, like the health insurance, but especially great benefits for people trying to work towards their education. They have a partnership with BHCC and EBNHC offers seven free credits per sememter at BHCC plus tuition reimbursement for full time employees.
cons: Not a lot of growth opportunities, and based on what I have seen so far what seems to get you promotions are how long you've been there, who you know and how great you suck up to your boss. Additionally, you can only apply for one promotion per year and it's frowned upon if you apply for more then one position when you do.

review_title: Could do better but they're complacent
job_title: Social Worker in Boston, MA
pros:
Fair accrual of time off. Mostly nice patients.
Good location, across Maverick T station.
IDT approach to patient care, it's everyone's responsibility to uphold a patient's well-being. The work gets done, people do their jobs.
cons:
They nickel and dime you for every hour if you're salaried. 
Lack of leadership.
Salary not competitive. No company culture upheld... Staff are unprofessional with interpersonal skills with each other.

review_title: EBNHC really does make a difference in the community and you can actually feel proud to be part of that.
job_title: Practice Secretary in East Boston, MA
pros: Being able to help people who really need it. Great atmosphere, good benefits, and the best coworkers I have ever had.
cons: Low pay. Most people, like me, end up leaving for a job at a big hospital where the pay is higher.

review_title: Fantastic place to work, deeply community focus
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Boston, MA
pros: This is a great place to work, with focus on employees and patients.  The work is challenging and rewarding.
cons: Traffic can be a challenge due to construction, but they offer free parking.

job_title: Program Manager in East Boston, MA
pros: Lots of training opportunities and great benefits package. Close to great schools and community centers. Plenty of parks nearby as well. Close knit departments provide supportive coworkers and teamwork environment.
cons: Difficult to move up in the organization, lots of commute between program and service sites. Lots of turnover of support staff and few opportunities to meet employees in other departments of the organization.

job_title: Referral Coordinator in Revere, MA
pros:
-Unlimited opportunities to learn. 
-Good location.
-Free parking.
-CEO is nice enough to stop by your desk and say hi regularly (this does not happen in a lot of places).
cons:
-Lower pay than other healthcare facilities in the area.
-High turnover rate.
-Not a lot of opportunities to grow.

review_title: Great Place to Grow and Learn
job_title: Program Coordinator in East Boston, MA
pros:
- strong support from management in my program
- my ideas and suggestions were taken into account, and implemented
- strong and positive reputation in the East Boston community and surrounding areas
cons:
- limited opportunity for upward mobility
- good benefits but relatively low pay at this level

job_title: Administrative Assistant in East Boston, MA
pros: Opportunities, good team work, professional and overall great place to work
cons: Unfortunately the department I am currently at has not been able to hold on to administrative directors leading to some downsides within the department

job_title: CNA/HHA in Brockton, MA
pros: Lots of hours,  flexibility,  great pay, Lots of opportunity to advance, not too physically demanding demanding.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Boston, MA
pros: Great staff, caring providers, flexible hours

job_title: Patient Access Representative in East Boston, MA
pros: Nothing. My experience working here is bad.  I dread going to work in the morning.
cons: Everything.  The management is horrible. Supervisor seems to favor workers.  They over work you with low pay.
